description: Apparently a back-formation from infighting, perhaps continuing Middle English infighten (“to attack”), from Old English infiht, infeoht (“an attack made upon a person by another in the same house or between members of a household”), equivalent to in- +‎ fight.

entries.meaning: An internal battle; a fight with allies or other members of the same group.

verbs.description: infight (third-person singular simple present infights, present participle infighting, simple past and past participle infought)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To fight with allies or other members of the same group.
(boxing) To box while extremely close to an opponent
